item.title: Mortgage Reform and Anti-Predatory Lending Act

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 247 - 174 (Roll no. 237). (text: CR H5313)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 247 - 174 (Roll no. 237).(text: CR H5313)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H5323)

DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 406. During the course of debate, Mr. Cardoza asked unanimous consent to modify the description of the Frank amendment numbered 2 printed in House Report 111-98 in the form provided to the desk. Agreed to without objection. Subsequently, the House resumed debate on H.Res. 406.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5313-5324)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 51.

The resolution provides that the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Financial Services now printed in the bill shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment. The resolution waives all points of order against the amendment in the nature of a substitute except for clause 10 of rule XXI. This waiver does not affect the point of order available under clause 9 of rule XXI (regarding earmark disclosure).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-98, by Mr. Cardoza.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 111-98, by Mr. Cardoza.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for further consideration of H.R. 1728 (Mortgage Reform and Anti-Predatory Lending Act).

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Sets forth the rule for further consideration of H.R. 1728 (Mortgage Reform and Anti-Predatory Lending Act).

bill.title: Providing for further consideration of the bill (H.R. 1728) to amend the Truth in Lending Act to reform consumer mortgage practices and provide accountability for such practices, to provide certain minimum standards for consumer mortgage loans, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
